title: Lebanon: A country plunged into darkness
description: Lebanon’s ongoing crisis has plunged the country into darkness, with some experiencing power cuts for 20 hours a day.

title: How a monkey launched the pop-it toy craze
description: Why it took a TikTok primate to turn a forty-year-old idea into a global hit

title: Respect: Jennifer Hudson on embodying soul legend Aretha Franklin
description: The singer was personally selected by soul legend Franklin to play her in the new biopic Respect.

title: Leicestershire sisters on track for Olympic glory
description: Indienne and Shaikira have both recently been crowned national champions.

title: 'Why disrupt it?' Southgate on lack of substitutions before Poland equaliser
description: Boss Gareth Southgate did not make any substitutions before Poland's late equaliser in their World Cup qualifier as he felt confident England were in control.

title: The models that turned Instagram into their DIY catwalk
description: New York Fashion Week marks a tentative return - but how did supermodels keep working through Covid?

title: Afghan Special Forces commander faced race against time to flee
description: An Afghan Special Forces commander says he owes his life to members of the Parachute Regiment who helped him escape.

title: The Kenyans who are helping the world to cheat
description: Some Kenyans try to escape poverty by helping foreign students to fake their academic work.

title: Why people in Eswatini are protesting
description: Eswatini is Africa’s last absolute monarchy, which means the king controls everything.

title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

title: 'My flight home was booked for two weeks ago'
description: British teenager Emma Raducanu expresses her surprise at her run to the US Open semi-finals, having had flights back to the UK booked a fortnight ago.

title: Afghanistan: A new order begins under the Taliban's governance
description: The Taliban's new ministers have taken office - but are they any different this time around?

title: Attenborough to Climate Assembly: 'You've given me a lot of hope'
description: Sir David Attenborough met with members in Parliament to discuss action on climate change.

title: Afghanistan: Could Pakistani drones hit the Panjshir Valley?
description: There are claims that Pakistan has used drones against anti-Taliban forces in Afghanistan.

title: Hemel Hempstead transformed for Hanks WW2 drama
description: Filming for Masters of the Air takes place on a High Street which is turned into a 1940s set.

title: Social care: Will people still have to sell their homes?
description: In 2019, the Conservatives pledged no-one should have to sell their home to pay for their care.

title: Fortnite gamer's mum becomes pro herself
description: Anne Fish began as her son's manager and has just signed a professional gaming contract.

title: Scotland's hottest September day in 115 years
description: A temperature of 28.6C has been recorded in the Scottish Borders - the highest since a record in Moray in 1906.

title: Paris attacks 2015: Historic trial of 20 suspects opens in France
description: Twenty men are on trial in Paris accused of involvement in France's worst post-WWII atrocity.

title: Buttler will definitely play in fifth Test against India - Root
description: Jos Buttler will return as England's vice-captain and wicketkeeper for the fifth and final Test against India at Emirates Old Trafford.

title: Eight to miss Premier League games as Brazil invoke ban
description: Eight Premier League players will be stopped from playing for their clubs this weekend after Brazilian football authorities trigger a Fifa rule to prevent them appearing.

title: Thunderstorms cause flash-flooding in Devon
description: Businesses are affected and roads made impassable due to flood water caused by downpours.

title: Amazon pays £492m in UK tax as sales surge to £20.6bn
description: The online retail giant saw UK sales rise by 50% last year amid a Covid-driven hike in demand.

title: Nicole Scherzinger hits back at 'false' Pussycat Dolls reunion claims
description: The Pussycat Dolls star is being sued by the band's founder for refusing to join a reunion tour.

title: Russian emergencies minister Zinichev dies on Arctic drill
description: Yevgeny Zinichev was killed while trying to save a cameraman who had fallen into water, reports say.

title: Social care tax rise: MPs to hold Commons vote later
description: Boris Johnson says plan to raise National Insurance by 1.25 percentage points is "reasonable and fair".

title: Climate change: Animals shapeshifting to stay cool, study says
description: Warm-blooded animals are evolving to have larger beaks, legs and ears to stay cool, scientists say.

title: Emma Raducanu: British great Virginia Wade says teenager 'ticks all the right boxes'
description: Three-time major winner Virginia Wade says Emma Raducanu has what it takes to become a dominant force in tennis and believes the US Open quarter-finalist can win a Grand Slam one day.

title: Afghanistan: Don't recognise Taliban regime, resistance urges
description: The all-men interim cabinet includes names of people on the US and UN most-wanted lists.

title: Will people already paying for care get extra help? And other questions
description: We answer your questions about the the government's plans to reform social care in England.

title: JLS comeback: 'The energy is still there'
description: The hit boy band tell Radio 1 Newsbeat why they're back after an eight-year break.

title: Was victory in Austria Scotland's most important win in 14 years?
description: Is Scotland's victory over Austria in Vienna their most significant since edging out France in Paris back in 2007?

title: Indonesia prison fire: Tangerang jail blaze kills 41 inmates
description: All of the dead, including two foreigners, were inmates, with guards unable to unlock doors in time.

description: England boss Gareth Southgate wants to maintain their 100% record in World Cup qualifying against Poland on Wednesday.

title: Rents outside London rising at fastest rate since 2008
description: Rents are increasing at their fastest pace in more than 10 years, according to property website Zoopla.

title: Mexico: Powerful earthquake hits Acapulco
description: The magnitude-seven quake struck near Acapulco, and was felt around 370 km away in Mexico City.

title: The 46-year-old former Sampdoria star returning to playing after 12-year drugs ban
description: Two bans for cocaine use seemed certain to end Francesco Flachi's career - but he is now closing in on an unlikely return at the age of 46.

description: The announcement of a tax rise to pay for social care leads all of the morning papers.

description: Through interviews with insiders, BBC News has pieced together an account of how Afghanistan’s government unravelled.

title: Paris attacks: Historic day of reckoning for night of terror
description: Survivors and families attend the long-awaited trial of 20 men accused of the deadly 2015 attacks.
